page.title: 15HOUSING-GALSTON
page.content: Housing patterns in Galston reveal a very clear pattern of growth relating to the historical controls which have influenced the town.The central area, dating mainly from the late 19th C has Victorian red and white sandstone buildings with several examples of Georgian architecture.The Victorian buildings take the form of imposing buildings e.g. Sharps hosiery factory and St. Sophia's R.C. Chapel, semi- detached and detached villas and miners' rows.The latter have been either demolished or completely renovated leaving only the exterior intact.There is a large inter-war council housing estate and more recent private estates built in the last 20 years.There are plans to modernise and expand both sectors. Based on the most recent census Galston has 67% council and 33% private housing.
